content:
Yes, there are many other popular tourist destinations in New Zealand that are related to filming. Here are some of them:
 
1. Weta Workshop - Located in Wellington, this is the studio that created the special effects for The Lord of the Rings, The Hobbit, King Kong, and other iconic movies. Visitors can tour the workshop and see how the magic is created.

2. Mount Victoria - The forests around Mount Victoria in Wellington were used to film many of the scenes from The Lord of the Rings trilogy. Visitors can take a guided tour of the filming locations and see where the iconic scenes were shot.

3. Waitakere Ranges - The forested hills west of Auckland were used to film many of the jungle scenes from King Kong. Visitors can take a guided hiking tour of the rainforest and see where the movie was filmed.

4. Lake Wakatipu - The stunningly beautiful Lake Wakatipu in Queenstown was used as one of the filming locations for The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers. It served as the backdrop for the Battle of the Pelennor Fields.

These destinations and many more make New Zealand a popular filming location and an exciting destination for movie lovers and travelers alike.
